column4: anyone? can't get my USB network adapter working with ndiswrapper, im on my second day trying to get this thing going
the biggest problem people run into with ndiswrapper is using the wrong drivers even though they have the same name
got the drivers from the d-link website and have both of them installed, both are detected
match up lspci with lspci -n and get the drivers from the ndiswrapper wiki. 99% of the time that clears up the problems
you'll be matching the lsusb -n (I think)
lsusb doesn't seem to have the option for -n
am i looking for vendor and product id?
-d seems to show vendor and productid, is that what im supposed to be looking for in lsusb?
the xxxx:xxxx code for device ID
ok i think thats -d lemme try it
it appears to be 2001:3a03, does that sound about right?
now which wiki was it that i was supposed to search this ID for?
I'll see if I can get the link for the exact page
